tool_description:
The Best Podcast API for Search, Directory, and Insights.

Note: We have deprecated this version of API (v1) from RapidAPI since 2019.

Please use the latest version v2 at https://www.podcastapi.com/
name: ListenNotes
title: ListenNotes

api_list.name: Fetch a list of supported countries/regions for best podcasts
api_list.description: It returns a dictionary of country codes (e.g., us, gb...) & country names (United States, United Kingdom...). The country code is used in the query parameter "region" of the /api/v1/best_podcasts endpoint.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://listennotes.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/regions"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "listennotes.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://listennotes.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/regions"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "listennotes.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Fetch recommendations for a podcast
api_list.description: Up to 8 podcast recommendations based on the given podcast id

optional_parameters.name: safe_mode
optional_parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude podcasts/episodes with explicit language. 1 is yes and 0 is no. Default: 0.

api_list.name: Fetch recommendations for an episode
api_list.description: Up to 8 episode recommendations based on the given episode id

optional_parameters.name: safe_mode
optional_parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude podcasts/episodes with explicit language. 1 is yes and 0 is no. Default: 0.

api_list.name: Fetch a random podcast episode
api_list.code:

url = "https://listennotes.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/just_listen"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "listennotes.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Fetch a curated list of podcasts by id
api_list.description: You can get the id of a curated list from /api/v1/search?type=curated or /api/v1/curated_podcasts

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: id for a specific curated list of podcasts. You can get the id from the response of /api/v1/search?type=curated or /api/v1/curated_podcasts

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://listennotes.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/curated_podcasts/9c0iYKTzbtS"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "listennotes.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://listennotes.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/curated_podcasts/{id}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "listennotes.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Fetch curated lists of podcasts
api_list.description: A bunch of curated lists from online media. For each list, you'll get basic info of up to 5 podcasts. To get detailed meta data of all podcasts in a specific list, you need to use /api/v1/curated_podcasts/{id}. We constantly add new curated lists to the database.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Page number of curated lists. Default: 1

api_list.name: Fetch meta data for a podcast by id
api_list.description: Fetch meta data for a specific podcast. You can get id from search api's response.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: id for a specific podcast. You can get id from search api's response.

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: How do you want to sort the episodes of this podcast? Available options: recent_first (default), oldest_first

optional_parameters.name: next_episode_pub_date
optional_parameters.description: Used for episodes pagination. Typically, it's the value of next_episode_pub_date from the response of last request. If not specified, just return latest 10 episodes or oldest 10 episodes, depending on the value of "sort" parameter.

api_list.name: Full-text Search

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: What to search: "episode" (default), "podcast", or "curated"? Note: "curated" is for curated lists of podcasts.

optional_parameters.name: genre_ids
optional_parameters.description: A comma-delimited string of a list of genre ids. You can find the id and the name of all genres in the response of /api/v1/genres . It works only when "type" is episode or podcast.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description: Limit search results to a specific language. If not specified, it'll be any language. You can get a list of supported languages from /api/v1/languages endpoint. It works only when "type" is episode or podcast.

optional_parameters.name: safe_mode
optional_parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude podcasts/episodes with explicit language. 1 is yes and 0 is no. Default: 0. It works only when "type" is episode or podcast.

optional_parameters.name: sort_by_date
optional_parameters.description: Sort by date or not? If 1, sort by date. If 0 (default), sort by relevance.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Offset for search results, for pagination. You'll use next_offset from response for this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: ocid
optional_parameters.description: A podcast id (the podcast_id field in response). This parameter is to limit search results in a specific podcast. It works only when "type" is episode.

optional_parameters.name: ncid
optional_parameters.description: A podcast id (the podcast_id field in response). This parameter is to exclude search results from a specific podcast. It works only when "type" is episode.

optional_parameters.name: only_in
optional_parameters.description: Search only in specific fields. Allowed values: title, description, author, audio. If not specified, then search every fields

optional_parameters.name: len_max
optional_parameters.description: Maximum audio length in minutes. Applicable only when type parameter is "episode".

optional_parameters.name: len_min
optional_parameters.description: Minimum audio length in minutes. Applicable only when type parameter is "episode".

optional_parameters.name: published_after
optional_parameters.description: Only show episodes published after this timestamp (in milliseconds). Default: 0 (since the very first episode). If published_before & published_after are used at the same time, published_before should be bigger than published_after.

optional_parameters.name: published_before
optional_parameters.description: Only show episodes published before this timestamp (in milliseconds). Default: now.  If published_before & published_after are used at the same time, published_before should be bigger than published_after.

api_list.name: Fetch meta data for an episode by id
api_list.description: Fetch meta data for a specific episode. You can get id from search api's response.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: id for a specific episode. You can get id from search api's response.

        }

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Typeahead

optional_parameters.name: safe_mode
optional_parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude podcasts/episodes with explicit language. 1 is yes and 0 is no. Default: 0. This is only applicable when show_podcasts=1

optional_parameters.name: show_genres
optional_parameters.description: Autosuggest genres. 1 is yes, 0 is no. Default: 0

optional_parameters.name: show_podcasts
optional_parameters.description: Autosuggest podcasts. This only searches podcast title and publisher and returns very limited info of 5 podcasts. 1 is yes, 0 is no. It's a bit slow to autosuggest podcasts, so we turn it off by default. Default: 0. If show_podcasts=1, you can also pass iTunes id (e.g., 474722933) to the q parameter to fetch podcast meta data.

api_list.name: Fetch a list of supported languages for podcasts
api_list.description: Get a list of languages that are supported in Listen Notes database. You can use the language string as query parameter in the search API
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://listennotes.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/languages"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "listennotes.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Fetch a list of podcast genres
api_list.description: Get a list of podcast genres that are supported in Listen Notes. The genre id can be passed to Search API and filter results by specific genres. You may want to cache this list of genres on the client side.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://listennotes.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/genres"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "listennotes.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Fetch a list of best podcasts by genre
api_list.description: Get a list of curated best podcasts by genre. You can get the genre ids from /api/v1/genres endpoint

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Page number of those podcasts in this genre.

optional_parameters.name: safe_mode
optional_parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude podcasts/episodes with explicit language. 1 is yes and 0 is no. Default: 0.

optional_parameters.name: genre_id
optional_parameters.description: You can get the id from /api/v1/genres. If not specified, it'll be all podcasts.

optional_parameters.name: region
optional_parameters.description: Filter best podcasts by country/region. You can get the supported country codes from the /api/v1/regions endpoint. Default: us
